docs.snippet: With the police arresting half as many people and giving more than 90 percent fewer tickets, some residents were relieved while others feared for their safety....
docs.lead_paragraph: With the police arresting half as many people and giving more than 90 percent fewer tickets, some residents were relieved while others feared for their safety.
docs.abstract: New York City police officers, for two consecutive weeks, have been ignoring minor criminal offenses and parking violations so completely that only 347 summonses were issued in one-week period, down from 4,077 in same period year earlier; stark numbers reflect ongoing tension between officers and Mayor Bill de Blasio.

headline.main: Life in New York City, Where Arrests Are Down and Tickets Are Rarities
headline.print_headline: Snapshot of City as Some Officers Turn a Blind Eye

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, Ann Farmer, J. David Goodman, Winnie Hu, Nate Schweber and John Surico.

docs.snippet: Call this what it is: a reckless, coordinated escalation of a war between the police unions and Mayor Bill de Blasio....
docs.lead_paragraph: Call this what it is: a reckless, coordinated escalation of a war between the police unions and Mayor Bill de Blasio.
docs.abstract: Editorial excoriates New York City police officers and their unions for deliberate slowdown, noting that mass inaction is dangerous and will only increase tension between department and Mayor Bill de Blasio; urges de Blasio to be more forceful in dealing with this insubordination and offers specific ways he can fight back.

docs.snippet: A jury at a coroner's inquest determined Wednesday that a Montana police officer was justified in shooting and killing an unarmed man high on methamphetamine during a traffic stop....
docs.lead_paragraph: A jury at a coroner's inquest determined Wednesday that a Montana police officer was justified in shooting and killing an unarmed man high on methamphetamine during a traffic stop.

headline.main: Killing of Unarmed Montana Man by Police Found Justified
headline.print_headline: Killing of Unarmed Montana Man by Police Found Justified

byline.original: By ANNIE CORREAL and ANDY NEWMAN

docs.snippet: One man sought in the deadly shooting at a French satirical paper has turned himself in, and police hunted Thursday for two heavily armed men with possible links to al-Qaida in the military-style, methodical killing of 12 people at the office of a...
docs.lead_paragraph: One man sought in the deadly shooting at a French satirical paper has turned himself in, and police hunted Thursday for two heavily armed men with possible links to al-Qaida in the military-style, methodical killing of 12 people at the office of a satirical newspaper that caricatured the Prophet Muhammad.

headline.main: 12 Dead in Attack on Paris Newspaper Charlie Hebdo, Including the Editor
headline.print_headline: Hunt for 2 in French Shooting That Killed 12; 1 Surrenders
